page.title: 04 Church Life in Wilby
page.content: Like other village churches in the area Wilby church has suffered from a decline in attendance at its services. Out of a population of over 500 people only about 20 attend the Sunday morning service. Since 1962 Wilby has not had its own rector,but shares one with a neighbouring parish in Wellingborough. He spends 1&1/2 days in Wilby and the rest of the time in Wellingborough. There is a small{ Sunday school} with about 12 children,a{ small choir} of 4 or 5 singers and a team of{ bell ringers} to ring the 6 bells of the tower. There is a {Women's Fellowship} which meets regularly and also arranges the church cleaning and flower decorations. The church is expensive to run, especially for a small congregation and a large sum of money will have to be raised to carry out repairs to preserve this church.
